Reviews.Title: “Only Hotel in Sherman Oaks or on Ventura Blvd”
Reviews.Author: KahunaHawaii
Reviews.Content: Best 3.5 star hotel on Ventura Blvd in Sherman Oaks/Encino. Located off the 405 fwy at the Ventura Fwy this hotel offers a very comfortable stay for the business or casual traveler or someone wanting to stay on Ventura Blvd in "the Valley". The rooms are clean and the well appointed. Big screen TV but it needs TIVO, coffee maker that should have instant coffee VIA instant instead of cheap coffee drip maker and paper cups. The rooms are not energy efficient.. they should make it so that you have to use your room card to activate lights and have to take the card out when you leave room.. which then turns off the lights....the fridge overheats under the counter so make sure you crank it to high if you want your beer cold. The gym is nice with a large TV and also individual TV on all machines. There is a large sun splashed deck and pool with a view south of Encino hills and the 405 Fwy. There is secure parking in the building and in/out access. The house staff is very nice,multi-lingual and the great service has the Marriott courtyard touch. The lobby is elegant and attractive, with a business center. The restaurant serves a nice breakfast for about $15. There is a lobby bar with big screen for sports but no happy hour and I would strongly recommend nice jazz music and even dancing in the lounge, because there is no nightlife or fun bars in the area. I saw Jim Simpson the famous sports announcer and his ABC crew. There in internet access. The paintings on the wll have nothing to do with LA life. The higher floors are accessed only with room card. The valley view rooms have a scenic view of the 405 Fwy interchange and in the morning before the smog you can see the entire valley to the mountain ranges. There is really nothing for entertainment in the Encino wastelands.. it is Ventura Blvd urban sprawl if you know what I mean. There is a Whole Foods nearby and you can easily walk 2 blocks under the fwy to the Sherman Oaks Galleria for movies at the Arclight and great happy hour dining @ Cheesecake Factory (4-6), El Torito Grill (4-8) or PF Changs (3-6). I would say walk because you get charged $10 for each hour you go over your 3 hour movie validation.. East toward Sherman Oaks has many nice restaurants. Marmalade and Mel's diner are great for BK, Fatburger is the best burger in LA, there is an In-N-Out, Izakaya on Ventura Blvd for Sushi is A+. Blue Dog is an excellent sports bar and burger grill... on the side street behind the Whole Foods parking lot. West on Ventura Blvd. is a Ralphs, high end Farfalla Italian restaurant and the only Starbucks in Encino. I did not like the homeless parking their shopping carts and smoking on the patio.. it messed up the aroma of my Kona Clover. If you have the guts and love seafood buffet.. Highly recommend Hokkaido seafood buffet...that is best buffet I have ever eaten at... just yummmy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business traveler hotel”
Reviews.Author: Belvederian
Reviews.Content: Service was prompt, friendly and efficient. Marriott Gold floor was very nice. Room was clean and spacious. Breakfast was good. Lobby area is clean and inviting. Parking was fine.

Reviews.Title: “i know the the only thing i was bothered by no cell cervice”
Reviews.Author: Christine M
Reviews.Content: it was very quiet and kept well.the maid service was verr good.i enjoyed ny time in california very much.

Reviews.Title: “really nice hotel, great service, good ADA facilties”
Reviews.Author: psage728
Reviews.Content: I visited family in Sherman Oaks and researched the area for a hotel with an ADA accessible room with roll in shower (wheel-chair) for other family members coming from NY. The hotel staff and concierge -Donald- were very patient with all my phone calls and questions. The ADA room has 2 queens and big bathroom with bars and the roll-in shower with fold down seat. My daughter and i has a 2 room suite, king bed with sofa bed. The king is very comfortable, sofa bed good enough for one adult or 2 kids. The suite has a seating area perfect for 6 adults and 2 babies visiting all day. Restaurant is decent but a bit limited. We requested --and got--a microwave. Coffeemaker in the room is like the Hamilton Beach personal pod brewer, i brought Senseo pods from home and they worked fine. Rooms have a balcony with interesting views of the mountains and freeways, doors are sealed for safety and noise reduction. Nice pool/spa area with fire pit and tables. On Ventura Blvd,.lots of stores and restaurants within walking distance, also a bus route. Parking is $15 day for guests, reasonable for this area. We really liked this hotel--comfortable, clean, attractive, quiet. I would stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, convenient, good value”
Reviews.Author: mvdljca
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight at the Courtyard at Sherman Oaks on Oscar weekend, when everything in Hollywood and the Westside seemed to be booked. The rooms are a little small but very clean and well appointed, with comfortable beds. Double glass doors kept out 95% of the racket from the Ventura Freeway screaming along eight stories below. The location is convenient to the Studio City-Universal Studios area, and the Westside is just a short hop back down the San Diego Freeway. There are plenty of eateries a 2-block walk away at the Galleria. Compared to similar properties in the general area, it's convenient and a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Fluffybunny6702
Reviews.Content: Hotel is where the 405 and 101 highways meet. Great locations, everything is within walking distance. Hotel has indoor parking garage connected to hotel which was very convienent but very expensive. Rooms are clean, decent size with a refrigerator. Would stay here again, but the room and parking prices are very expensive. There aren't many choices for hotels if you want to stay in this area.

Reviews.Title: “If you were in Sweden”
Reviews.Author: Alex O
Reviews.Content: Small, claustrophobic size, room. I felt I was in Sweden. Noisy, not only the noise from the street but also the noise from the water pipes. I was walk up from a sound sleep by somebody else taking a shower at 1 am. I called the front desk upset. The receptionist was very nice and tried very hard to keep me in the hotel, as I was set on leaving. She move me to a suite for the rest of the night. I will not stay there anymore. I am a Merriott elite member, if the staff cannot do the right thing at check in, it is too late to fix a wrong doing like this after midnight. But, if you decide to stay here, make sure to ask for a "normal" size room and ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “Great for extended stay”
Reviews.Author: GoddessDivine
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 8 nights for a business trip, and this was perfect for an extended stay. It was located 2 miles from my place of business so it was great to be so close. On my last trip to Sherman Oaks, this hotel had not yet opened, so I was obliged to stay in Universal City - the long commutes on I-405 made me feel as though I was back in NYC, ugh. This hotel is immaculate and service is excellent; very helpful and courteous staff who go that extra mile. The full-service restaurant was very good; the menu had the standard hotel fare but included some original dishes that were very tasty. My room had a small sitting area and a large desk area; free wi-fi was included. Nice large screen HDTV. This property is convenient to I-405 and 101 freeways; two blocks away is the Sherman Oaks Galleria with shops, food courts, movie theatres and the ubiquitous Cheesecake Factory :) I definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here on my next trip out west.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: C Kim L
Reviews.Content: First of all, I will admit that the traffic noise at this hotel is ridiculously bad. However, if one looks at a map, one will find that there are almost no hotels in this price range that are not located where they are subject to traffic noise. I stayed in the Hampton Inn on Sepulveda in Sherman Oaks in August and thought that noise was coming from Sepulveda. No! It's the 405. And on the other side of town, it could be any one of a number of different freeways. There is simply no escaping it. We were on the south side of the building 9 stories up and the noise, though constant, would peak in the early morning hours between 5:30 am and 7:30 am. The big trucks on the highway there make a ton of noise. But, since every other hotel in this price range has the same problem, it kind of cancels it out for me. The room did not smell bad. Housecleaning was thorough. Anything we needed, like toilet paper or shampoo was provided almost instantaneously. The lobby is large and nicely decorated. There is a bar area that was very convenient too. The staff at the front desk was always very helpful. When we checked in, there was a slight problem with the room. It was corrected and we were in a different room in less than two minutes. The elevators are FAST. This is especially helpful in getting in and out. We parked and while parking is expensive, again, its expensive everywhere. The parking garage was very convenient. I used the pool and spa and enjoyed it quite a bit. While the noise is always there and you can see the freeway, you can also see some mountains. The pool is heated just enough to make swimming possible in winter. (We were here in January.) The spa was clean and had strong jets. The beds were very comfortable and we had ample pillows. The TV was nice too. We stayed for 5 nights and will stay there again when we go to visit. While the location next to the freeway is not ideal because of the noise, it does make it very convenient to get wherever you want to go--as long as you don't want to go there during rush hour! I would also encourage the hotel to do something about the thermostat. It was frustrating that the unit could not simply be turned off. I didn't like it cycling on and off during the night.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Gem in Sherman Oaks,CA”
Reviews.Author: viappc
Reviews.Content: This relatively small Marriott property, is very well maintained, and the staff is very professional. They were very friendly, yet professional and proper. The staff exudes respect for guests, and are very accommodating. By the way, there is absolute quiet, as you sleep in this business city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and convenient”
Reviews.Author: rocor335
Reviews.Content: If you need to get to UCLA, the Getty Center, Century City, this is as convenient as you can get. Directly off the San Diego Freeway, but once you're there, it's very quiet. Big parking in the back. Everything is new and nice here. Pool and hot tub in the back courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, comfortable, and quiet”
Reviews.Author: CBlancq
Reviews.Content: First, being a Starwoods member, I was skeptical of staying at a Courtyard, but I had a wonderful experience at this hotel. The hotel is conveniently located near the 405 & 101 in the valley & is about 15 minutes away from Sunset Blvd. Ventura Blvd is just down the block & there are many restaurants in the area. In reading the reviews, I was concerned about quietness. We stayed on the 10th floor & since the sliding doors/windows were double-paned, we had no issues with noise. The sound from the air conditioning unit was noticeable, but was not more noisy then most hotels I've stayed at. The beds were very comfortable, the room was clean, & the bathroom was a decent size. The front desk lady, Gema, was very professional & check-in was very easy. The hotel had also noted my request for a quieter room and also accommodated my request for a late check-out. The hotel does charge $15 for parking, but it is in a secured lot, with in and out privileges. I would not hesitate to stay here again for the convenience & service.

Reviews.Title: “comfy, convenient and friendly”
Reviews.Author: sara46California
Reviews.Content: we had to stay overnight in the sherman oaks area of Los Angeles and found this marriott. i cannot say enough nice things about it. from front desk staff to the manager and parking attendant, everyone was so friendly, warm and welcoming. very nice room and comfortable bed and free perks including free delicious coffee int he lobby and cookies at checkin. thecmanager easily straightened out a booking error and couldn't have been more professional. highly recommended. also, very conveniently located to freeway, getty, skirball, etc.

Reviews.Title: “If you are a light sleeper the noise is an issue, but the interior is very beautiful.”
Reviews.Author: Nina961
Reviews.Content: I had read several reviews and was concerned about the noise. I'm a light sleeper so this is always one of my main criteria. I stayed on the 6th floor, away from the freeway but Ventura is a very loud street. This affected my sleeping. The hotel itself has been newly decocorated in a very attractive modern style and the bed was quite good. The fitness center was not in great repair. One machine was missing the TV screen and the audio output wasn't working in the other. I changed to a different hotel for my next visit due to these problems.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean rooms and the service is outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: Devon E
Reviews.Content: Fanstastic staff! Cleam rooms, comfortable bed and an ice cold a/c. Not too much more that you could ask for.

Reviews.Title: “JUST WHAT WE WERE LOOKING FOR”
Reviews.Author: gypsy724
Reviews.Content: Exactly what we wanted: something clean, modern, safe and within walking distance of dining/bars, all at a decent price. Bonus: the front desk clerk was extremely helpful and friendly. We made last minute reservations and he found us the best room available (with military discount!), offered us a late check out, and gave us a solid suggestion for our evening out. We had a great nite across the street at the Valley View, even met a military hero at the bar. Then we came back to our super-comfortable bed. I have NOT ONE THING to complain about. Excellent stay, excellent hosts.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good....but only one thing”
Reviews.Author: pickylady35
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Courtyard from July 26th to July 30th. I always do reviews before I stay or eat anywhere but this is the first time I actually took the time to write a review. PROS: When I checked in staff at desk were very courteous and room key was ready --took less than 5 Min.Although I requested high floor I was given mid range. I was worried because I know in LA rooms are given away without a second thought even when you have reservations this was not the case at this hotel Loved that they had free ue of computer and printer. This was very important to me as I dont' like to tavel with my computer with all the new regulations in terms of flying and paying for luggage. I had to go to front desk twice for just general things --every time I was greeted and helped immediately. Security at parking garage always greeted me with smile, very helpful and seemed genuine. Convenient to CSUN, airport and anywhere I needed to go in the LA area as I am relocating so I was all over the place searching for apt. Housekeeping was very good, when we arrived room was clean and everyday she/he did a good job. I asked for more towels and was promptly brought to my room. I always check every inch of roon when /i check in--bedroom, sheets, bathroom etc all was in good order. Parking is cheap (15 day) and you can come and go as you like with no worries as there is a security guard always on duty and you need a card to access guest floors (felt very safe) Doors locked after hours, need card for entry --again felt very safe Free coffee and fresh cookies both very good and to my surprise the coffee was always hot! Walked to Sherman Oaks Galleria to movies and dinner --very convenient CONS: Two things that are most important cleanliness and condition of the bed and the shower/tub. Bathroom tub needs updating. Paint was chipping, some rust visible and there is no fan in bathroom, In terms of fan it was better than looking up and seeing a dirty vent that is never clean--on the other hand got a lot of steam after shower. Overall I would stay again! .

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Pleasant.”
Reviews.Author: FeltonS
Reviews.Content: On the recommendation of a colleague, who told me it was "decent," I spent three nights here and found that it was everything that I could possibly want for a breakneck business trip. The rooms are pleasant, the beds are comfortable, and the pillows are plentiful and varied. I had a large desk where I was able to work in the evenings, and the television system is well-stocked with a variety of channels to which I was able to fall asleep. Above all, I appreciated the FREE, very fast internet. Good for them - that's a savings over other hotels. The lobby is quiet, and the staff is no-frills but competent, friendly, and efficient. The neighborhood is okay - you have to walk a block-and-a-half, beneath the 405, to get to the Sherman Oaks Mall, and some restaurants. But if you're okay with not much other than that in the vicinity, then you should have no problem with this very solid business property.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SharonChandler_AZ
Reviews.Content: Great location - very clean and quiet. This was a great place to stay and very close to the freeways.

Reviews.Title: “really nice”
Reviews.Author: cathasson
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean, well appointed. This is a predictable Courtyard Marriott. It is in a good location with restaurants and stores nearby and safe parking. The staff was friendly and very professional. Our room was comfortable and clean. We would stay here again if needed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good location off the 405”
Reviews.Author: Preston71
Reviews.Content: In town visiting friends was very convienant and located right off the 405. I did not notice any noise in the room I had from the Freeway. Parking was ample and the parking rate was resonable. Rooms were comfortable and the hotel seemed generally well maintained. Staff was friendly. Serveral good restaurants within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pittsburgh_AS
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel on a regular basis during our work trips to Van Nuys. Reasons this hotel is great: - The rooms are lovely. Very clean and the bed are super comfortable. - The internet is very fast and FREE for hotel guests. - The hotel is walking distance to the Sherman Oaks Galleria, so there are plenty of restaurants, etc. close by. - The staff is very friendly and helpful. Only cons: - The food in the hotel restaurant is very pricey -- but, that isto be expected. The coffee is free for guests in the morning, but not if you dine in and your server brings it to you. - Some of my colleages have said they can hear traffic from the freeway, but I have never had a problem.

Reviews.Title: “One of the five best Courtyards I have ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: Viking94708
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a mate and excluding the fire alarm that was pulled by a pissed off guest after they were being evicted at 3 AM, it was perfect. It is clean and hip and looks like they handle the guest flow perfectly. I never waited in line for anything and they were always ready to serve. There is plenty of street parking, so i would avoid the parking charge. I've stayed at well over 50 Courtyards around the world and this is one to remember!

Reviews.Title: “Your default hotel when visiting LA!”
Reviews.Author: Fat32blue
Reviews.Content: Nothing but good things to say about this hotel on Ventura Boulevard....It has a dated exterior but that's where the nitpicking ends. The room was clean with modern conveniences....The bed was very comfortable and we had plenty of room for our 11-month-old's portable playpen. The staff was friendly and quite responsive.. We normally run away from hotel restaurants (for a number of reasons) but this one pulled us in......The FOOD IS FANTASTIC...Breakfast,lunch or dinner. You know you're doing well when locals drop by to eat. You can't beat the location...open the door and the popular Ventura Boulevard awaits

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Kims0304
Reviews.Content: Our first time at a Courtyard was a wonderful surprise. This particular branch was apparently used as a prototype to redesign Courtyards to have a more urban chic style. The result is great. The lobby and lounge are stunning with understated, modern design. The rooms are simpler, but comfortable, clean, modern, and spacious. The hotel is safe, with an inside, free parking area, and you have to use your room key to use the elevator. Breakfast is much cheaper than at Marriott, and at least as good. The staff is phenomenal. Mike, the front desk manager, and the rest of the front desk staff, were not just friendly and helpful with retrieving our lost luggage, they were genuinely enthusiastic and passionate about their unique Courtyard. From the bartender to the breakfast waitresses, all staff were great. We thank all of them for a great stay. They really made a difference. If we are ever back in the area, we’ll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good one.. but not great..”
Reviews.Author: AdarshP
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel.. but food is costly. staff is courteous.. but rooms were not that great...

Reviews.Title: “Very Chic for a Courtyard -Great Location”
Reviews.Author: flies2vacay
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a surprise- the lobby and rooms are very chic and modern. We managed to arrive late enough to park at the street meters beside the hotel and avoid $15 garage fee. This hotel is easy walk (2 blocks?) to Galleria outdoor mall (Cheesecake Factory, PF Changs). We stayed here after a day at Universal and it was a great place to wind down, walk to dinner, and do a little shopping. Had to call twice for a roll away bed but that was only hitch. Free coffee and $2 muffins in on-site cafe for quick breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “We expected more from a Courtyard by Marriott and we got it”
Reviews.Author: Avishai625
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many Courtyard by Marriott hotels around the world. We generally like them because of their upscale look, highly consistent good level of service and attention to details. This hotel even though a bit dated, met our expectations and therefore is one that we would recommend to our family and friends. It only needs a little more updating ( elevators, carpets, hallways, etc. ). The staff at the reception desk were great. This hotel is very good. Not excellent but very good.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: dwoods1073
Reviews.Content: I really liked this Marriott Courtyard. Our room and the common areas were spotless. We had a room on the penthouse floor with a nice view of the valley. My son loved the rooftop pool. The gym is small but has new equipment and was empty the two times I used it. We saved a lot of money by staying at this hotel rather than some of the other fancier ones and I was very pleased with the quality of the hotel and level of service.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ngtybtnice
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel twice within the same month - once when our original reservations at another hotel nearby was not honored and we were looking for an alternate place to stay in the area. This Marriott Courtyard is wonderful! It has easy access to both the 405 and the 101 Freeways. The rooms are clean and modern, the staff is friendly and helpful. There is ample underground parking (for a small fee). Our room had a breathtaking view. We would recommend this hotel to everyone. In fact we plan on staying there every time we come to the Los Angeles area, as we have family living nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value hotel, good service and rooms”
Reviews.Author: ivanov0704
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Courtyard LA Sherman Oaks with my wife for 3 nights in late August 08. We chose this hotel due to its proximity to our friend’s house and again paid with points. Location is not ideal and I would have probably chosen another hotel by the beach if it wasn’t for my friend living nearby. The overall experience was quite positive: rooms were clean and comfortable, it was the only hotel that had treasonable price for the Internet and parking, personnel was friendly and helpful. We didn’t spent too much time in the hotel so we didn’t really get to use the pool or the gym, but both seemed good proper facilities for this type of hotel. I think value for points this was the best choice so I am sure the same goes for value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Requested Quiet Room but got one facing freeway for a sleepless night”
Reviews.Author: SusanYossi
Reviews.Content: This is a great location but because of it being convenient to the 405 and Ventura Freeways if you have a room on the side of the hotel facing the freeway you will need earplugs and perhaps sleeping pills (we had neither) in order to sleep. We had asked for a high room and quiet. We were given the top floor (called penthouse) and noticed at once that it faced the freeway but had assumed (erroneously) that the windows were double glazed and would block the sound. We left the room almost immediately upon check in and didn't return until nearly midnight. The sound coming from the freeway traffic was so loud we could hear the trucks shift gears and both my husband and I spent a horrible sleepless night. In the morning I asked to be given a room on the other side of the hotel. The only available one was on the fifth floor and was darker due to a smaller window but that night was totally quiet and provided a good sleep. To the hotel's credit we were credited the parking fees for both nights as we had used Marriott points to pay for the room. The deskclerk was extremely apologetic but I am sure they are aware of the noise problem and we should not have been given a room on that side of the hotel. This hotel has been remodeled nicely since it has become a Courtyard, (was several other hotels prior to being a Courtyard) but is an old hotel with old plumbing and in the first room the bathtub didn't drain. We loved the location and the free Seattle's Best Coffee in the lobby in the morning and the room refrigerators. The other problem is the noisy heating/ airconditioning unit. Fortunately we were able to shut it off entirely during the night. Too bad the plumbing and heating units can't be updated along with the rooms and public spaces. A nice and convenient place to stay IF you are on the side away from the freeway.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant”
Reviews.Author: DarlingtonPhill
Reviews.Content: brilliant, the hotel was excellent i turned up with my family 3 hrs early and they let me check in with no fuss , the room was clean and comfortable and the hotel facilities was great very convenient for local attractions only a short drive from universal and beaches

Reviews.Title: “Noisy no matter what side you are on”
Reviews.Author: LuvzTennis
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this courtyard last Friday night. I must agree the noise level from the highway and the busy street it was on was unbearable to me. You could hear the motorcycles all night long. I would not stay there again. The lobby is nice but the rest of the hotel is just o.k.. Actually rather depressing. I was on the 7th floor and requested the quiet side. They said they put me in a quiet room. Will be looking for a new hotel for the next trip out.

Reviews.Title: “Nicer than average Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: The_Diva_Traveler
Reviews.Content: I usually hate Courtyards, but this one was a nice surprise. At check in, I was upgraded to a decent suite. The decor was upscale and even on the trendy side. There is even a restaurant open for all meals and for Room Service. Hotel rooms have cheap furnishings and the bathrooms are cheesy. I'll never understand why Marriott has such shallow bathtubs! Still, it's a great location and a much better value than your average Courtyard. Great bet for business travel.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ab3273
Reviews.Content: I was booked in here by my corporate travel agent. I stay at Courtyards a lot and usually very reliable. The location is good with respect to freeways. But I have to tell you the highway noise was amazingly loud. I couldn't sleep even after pulling both sets of drapes and making sure the doors were closed properly. I read the other reviews and they must be by employees of the hotel as they are a joke. Even though the hotel was obviously redone at some point they left the old doors that allow noise and wind right through. Also I couldn't get the allegedly free internet to work despite calling the vendor.. Sorry I woudl stay away unless you plan to up partying all night and don't need to sleep

Reviews.Title: “A higher level Courtyard - very good!”
Reviews.Author: Charlesgate
Reviews.Content: Both room quality and service at this "Courtyard" were of the quality that I would expect from a higher level Marriott hotel. We were visiting family in Sherman Oaks, so the location was key for us, but I would consider staying here too as a mid-point with good driving access to both Malibu and LA. I selected this hotel based on prior reviews and I found them right on the mark. The hotel is very close to the 405. While our view was of the highway, it's far enough so that noise was not a problem. The fitness room is small, but adequate with 2 treadmills, an elliptical, rowing machine, weights and one TV. The outdoor pool on the 4th floor is in a pleasant, quiet location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: fs5
Reviews.Content: We happened upon this hotel by driving through Sherman Oaks. It was about 7:00 pm, and my husband, 18 year old son and I had been driving all day from Santa Barbara. We saw this hotel, pulled in and got a room. Beautifully decorated hotel. Our room was large, with 2 queen beds, wireless internet, nice bedding, flat screen tv. Very clean and up to date. We went to the front desk to see about where we should go for dinner. They were VERY helpful. We said we wanted Italian food, and the clerk recommended a place, then proceeded to make a reservation there for us. The restaurant she recommended was excellent! There were 3 computers with printer in the lobby that were available for guests to use. We had breakfast in the cafe in the hotel, which was average. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel. It was perfect for a quick stay, and I would definetely return!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, nice place”
Reviews.Author: Dazzer6666
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a 5 night break in February after reading the reviews . We were looking for a decent-standard, reasonably priced hotel in a good location, and basically that's what we got. Good things: -big rooms (2 queen sized beds) with coffee maker, refurbished bathroom, big TV, fridge (no mimi-bar), comfy chair etc. Great linen/pillows/beds -friendly and efficient service from front desk, valet parking and others -nice breakfast spread (although several kids running amok with the waffle maker made a mess !) -nice pool (very quiet) and loungers -reasonable gym (also quiet) -range of sweets etc available behing the front desk for those late night snack attacks -nice bar -free internet access in the lobby -shopping/eating mall next door with a few restaurants if you don't want to stray too far. Chain places only though - Cheesecake Factory, El Toritos, Fuddruckers etc Other stuff to think about (not necessarily negative) -apart from the mall, not much else within walking distance -valet parking good but USD 22 per day (plus tips). Might be able to park on the streets a block or two behind (but we never tried it) All in all, good value. Not a central location but we knew that. If you don't know LA, beware the heavy traffic 24 hours a day !

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: sssmac
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean hotel with good service and all necessary amenities. Great location, right by the main highway. No noise complaints from us, maybe because we did so much in the days we were exhausted by bedtime. Breakfast (not included) is also very good. Our room was just like the photos I saw on previous reviews. Only thing is that we wished parking was included..its $15 a night to park.

Reviews.Title: “Sleek Valley Gem”
Reviews.Author: familygirl66
Reviews.Content: Our family of four booked into a luxurious King Suite as we were attending a 3 day function nearby and needed space and privacy. It was beautifully appointed, with a king sized bed in one room and a couch, fridge, coffee machine, desk, and chairs in the second room.There was enough room in the living room to accommodate a roll-out bed as well. Both rooms had modern TVs and attractive fittings. The bathroom was spacious and clean and had a large supply of plush towels and lovely toiletries. Although the hotel is built right next to a busy freeway, I didn’t find the traffic noise intrusive at all (we were on the ninth floor). There is reduced charge on-site parking at the property for about $15 a day and no breakfasts are included ($13 in the hotel restaurant). A cheaper option is to go the Sherman Oaks Galleria, 5 minutes away on foot, and buy breakfast at Starbucks (better value for a family). The hotel lobby is attractive, modern and welcoming and has 3 free computers for guest use, as well as a printer. There is also a laundry, pool area and gym. I was extremely happy at this property, slept well, and in general liked the neighborhood and its nearby amenities. In addition, the staff were very helpful and professional.

Reviews.Title: “another good Marriott”
Reviews.Author: TeresaupstateNY
Reviews.Content: This busy urban Marriott feels like a small boutique hotel, with a friendly staff and modern, well-designed interiors. It's right next to the 405 freeway, which is both convenient and noisy. However, the double glazing on the large windows keeps the highway noise down to a minimum. It's a pleasure to come into such a clean and comfortable room. The pure white cotton bedding that's now standard Marriott issue is great. Marriott made a good move when they went non-smoking chainwide. The breakfast (not included in the price) was good, and healthy options were there. The parking was a bit steep ($14 per night) but it was secure, and street parking seemed impossible.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! 100% Satisfied!”
Reviews.Author: kurly009
Reviews.Content: The quality of this hotel is excellent. I was traveling with my mother, sister and grandmother on a family vacation to Los Angeles. The hotel and rooms are very clean and nicely decorated, it has a contemporary decor (not old fashioned). The room was very spacious. The bathroom was a comfortable size and very clean. The water pressure in the shower was great too. The location is great, 5 miles from the Getty Museum, 14 miles from the airport, 9 miles from Hollywood.... just minutes away from all the attractions. The surrounding area is nice with plenty of restaurants and shops near by. It is next to a freeway but you do not hear passing cars from the room, outside noise is not a problem. The main attractions (Hollywood, Beverly Hills, Santa Monica, Airport, Studios, Getty Museum, etc) are only a short drive away. When the traffic is good it only takes about 10-15 minutes to get to most of these places. Traffic can sometimes be pretty bad, so when heading to the airport especially I suggest you leave an hour earlier than planned since that particular freeway can be becked up. Computers in the lobby for free internet and printer use for all guests. The cafe offers great food with lots of options. Full breakfast menus as well as cold and hot buffets available (cold $11, hot $14). Parking is approx. $15 a day, it was the best deal I was able to find when comparing parking at other hotels (most parking prices were over $20 a day). We felt very secure in the hotel as well, guests needed to use their room key to use the elevator to access the rooms. The staff was very helpful too. I would recommend this hotel to everyone I know. I was 100% satisfied and would stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: RiotPelaaja
Reviews.Content: For a franchise hotel, the Courtyard Marriots manage to feel comfortable and personal. The staff at the Sherman Oaks Marriot were very friendly. Especially the waiters during breakfast were lovely and gave one a great start to the day. The breakfast buffet was great for about 13$ you get a lot of variety and can make your own waffles! The lobby is spacious and has a great feel to it. The bar is right next to the entrance it's the usual hotel bar, not much else to say about it. The room I was in, was a regular two bed room and it was very spacious. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was big enough. The toiletries were fine. There was no safe in the room, which was a bit odd and also no minibar, though there was a fridge. The room felt comfortable and I had to work a lot during my stay and the work desk is allright, though the work chair stays rather low, which was a bit annoying. Still, I could definitely spend a longer time in the room if need be, it's comfortable enough. The gym is small, but well equipped and there was plenty of water and towels available. The pool area was surprisingly nice and it's very spacious. The hotel's in a great area to discover LA. Right next to the hotel there's the Sherman Oaks Galleria, which has a Cheesecake Factory restaurant, a Starbucks and lots of other restaurants. There's also an IHOP down the block. The nice thing is that there's even shops in the blocks surrounding the hotel, so it's actually worth walking around the area. Overall, a great, comfortable hotel with great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased with the Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: BKKandKSK
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Courtyard the other night when our power went out and the city was in the midst of a 110 degree heat wave. We literally walked in without reservations. The front desk staff (bravo Grace!!) was extremely helpful despite the fact that they were obviously busy. Grace was able to take care of our needs--crib for our infant, suite to accommodate all of us, etc.--without batting an eye. (Granted, it may help that I am a premium level Marriot member.) The price was fair, although given the heat, I would have given her a kidney if I could have had an air conditioned room for the night. I don't know if they allow pets, but no one squawked when we brought our dog in (somewhat hidden from view) as she couldn't stay at home without a/c!! The location is great for tourists and locals alike. While our 10th floor windows faced the freeway, it was quite and peaceful. My on concern, and it is a minimal one, is that the restaurant didn't open until 7 am for breakfast. Most of the world won't care, but when the kids are up and hungry at dawn, ya gotta feed them somehow! Lucky for us, the power was on the next day and we could move home, but this did make for a nice mini-vacation.

Reviews.Title: “First class all round!”
Reviews.Author: JamesG_uk
Reviews.Content: The pictures on the website look almost too good to be true: bright colours in the rooms and lobby areas; a rooftop pool overlooking the Hollywood Hills with a palm tree and in line for the most glorious sunsets each night. On this occasion, the camera does not lie. The hotel is fabulous – and for all the right reasons. The hotel is newly refurbished, less than 3 years ago. The carpets still feel soft and new as you walk over them in your shoes. The staff are slick and friendly – and the lobby area is of the standard you would find in the most luxurious and trendy boutique hotels. I received a personal phonecall from the manager of the hotel welcoming me to the area and asking if there was anything he could do to assist. A nice touch – and genuine too! If you end up with a room facing the South side, bring a pair of binoculars to enjoy the view of some of the most expensive homes set in the Hollywood Hills. Our experience was great from beginning to end. There is free wireless in the room and a public computer area downstairs. The hotel charges $14.00/day for parking which is not that bad considering that regular users of the parking lot are charged $23.00/day. The rooftop pool is also something of a highlight. It was clean and tidy with a great view of the Sherman Oaks area. The pool was warm, as was the hot tub too. I would say that for a courtyard hotel, this has to be one of the best – and you are only 9 miles drive from Santa Monica and even less from Beverly Hills. It’s also slightly warmer than staying on the opposite side of the hills. I would have no hesitation in recommending this place and staying there once again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasantly Surprised!!”
Reviews.Author: jdltravel
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in several Courtyard properties, I was very pleasantly surprised by this location. It had a much more upscale feel to it than others in the chain. The staff was friendly and professional. The bar area had a certain elegance. I give it a solid 4 stars, though was tempted to give it 5 just because it thoroughly exceeded my expectations. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Sets the standard for Courtyard Hotels!”
Reviews.Author: DeLaCampo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Courtyard for a weekend with my girlfriend and was pleasantly surprised with the hotel. It's very nicely appointed and seems recently redone (nice pool area as well). Check-in personnel were very friendly and welcoming. We forgot to ask for a king bedroom, but within minutes they came up to our room to give us a new set of keys for a different room on the top floor. Concierge services were excellent too - We called to get dinner reservations and they came up with some good dinner options and called everywhere to try to make last-minute reservations. Within 15 minutes they called us back at the room to confirm our reservation and dropped off print-outs of the directions to the restaurant as well! Also hotelbar and restaurant personnel are extremely friendly and really went out of their way to make sure everything was fine. It's a great location (right next to the ramp onto the 405) in terms of getting to beverly hills, hollywood or santa monica, but there are also plenty of shops & restaurants along venture blvd to check out (even within walking distance). I've stayed at many courtyards and hotels alike for business and pleasure, but I was really surprised with the level of service and style of this hotel. I would definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: FPL10
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to LA. We choose this hotel on a recommendation of people we were visiting. Like previous guests we can't fault the location, close to I-405. Staff were friendly and helpful. The gym is adequate and but the outdoor pool area was more nice to look at than useful because it was too cold (and windy on some days) to utilise. Noise from the 405 was constant if you face that side. I suspect the rooms on the Ventura Blvd side are quieter as that road is less bsy at night. Didn't try the hotel's food as there was quite a lot of choice close by. The best value is probably the IHOP restaurant about 5-10 minutes walk away heading west on Ventura Blvd.

Reviews.Title: “i love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: misswendysf
Reviews.Content: So this was my home away from home for about 6 months- I was here 3 times per month. I love staying here- its consistently good. The beds are comfortable, the room service is good, the staff is endlessly polite and helpful. Once I got a room next to the elevator- they are loud and small with no view. There is one per floor so avopid this room. Otherwise its great. Parking is not cheap so if you're not on an expense account park on the street.

HotelInfo.Name: Courtyard Los Angeles Sherman Oaks
HotelInfo.Address: 15433 Ventura Boulevard, Sherman Oaks, Los Angeles, CA 91403
